title: Potato Salad Recipe
description: This potato salad is easy to make with red potatoes, pickles, hard-boiled eggs, and a creamy dressing for a favorite side at any summer BBQ!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Potato Salad Recipes Potato Salad 4.7 (287) 226 Reviews 67 Photos This potato salad is quick to make for a delicious summer side dish with old-fashioned flavor. Make it the day before you plan to serve it for the best flavor. Sure to be a hit at any BBQ or potluck! Submitted by MRANDAL Updated on April 9, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 67 67 67 67 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 20 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 20 servings 5 pounds red potatoes, chopped 3 cups mayonnaise 2 cups finely chopped pickles 5 large hard-cooked eggs, chopped ½ cup chopped red onion ½ cup chopped celery 3 tablespoons prepared mustard 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar 1 teaspoon salt, or to taste ½ teaspoon ground black pepper or to taste Directions Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain. Return potatoes to the empty pot to dry and cool. Stir mayonnaise, pickles, hard-cooked eggs, red onion, celery, mustard, and cider vinegar together in a large bowl; season to taste with salt and pepper. Fold in cooled potatoes until well combined. For best results, store potato salad in the refrigerator until chilled or overnight before serving to allow the flavors to meld. naples34102 I Made It Print 901 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 339 Calories 28g Fat 20g Carbs 4g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 20 Calories 339 % Daily Value * Total Fat 28g 35% Saturated Fat 4g 22% Cholesterol 54mg 18% Sodium 538mg 23% Total Carbohydrate 20g 7% Dietary Fiber 2g 8% Total Sugars 2g Protein 4g 8% Vitamin C 11mg 12% Calcium 25mg 2% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 571mg 12% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Potato Salad 01 of 67 Photo by  naples34102 02 of 67 Photo by  ReneePaj 11/30/2023 Great recipe for classic potato salad. I used small red potatoes (which are less starchy than other potatoes) as called for in the recipe and they added a nice flavor and bite to the salad. If your potatoes are still warm, they will absorb some of the dressing as they cool in the fridge making this salad flavorful and less soupy. My husband appreciated no sugar in the salad, as he doesn't like his potato salad with any hint of sweetness. The cooking time will depend on how small you cut your potatoes, so it will vary. Also, depending on the pickles used, you will get varying flavors too. I used my favorite Grillo's classic dills in this recipe and they were perfect. I halved the recipes as it makes a lot and it was fine. I also added a little smoked paprika-delish! I will be making this one again. 03 of 67 Photo by  TaheerAlibhai 08/07/2021 04 of 67 Photo by  Vinnie M 07/11/2021 05 of 67 Photo by  Patrice Dickinson 07/05/2021 Delicious and the perfect side to our July 4th BBQ! I added chopped red, yellow and green peppers for added crunch and color. I also use smoked paprika. I will definitely make this again. 06 of 67 Photo by  Lauren 05/29/2021 07 of 67 Photo by  ambedore81 04/21/2021 08 of 67 Photo by  christiannicole2102 12/31/2020 09 of 67 Photo by  Janelle Jones 12/28/2020 10 of 67 Photo by  Janelle Jones 12/28/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Green Bean and Potato Salad 197 Ratings All-American Loaded Baked Potato Salad 29 Ratings Red-Skinned Potato Salad 2,427 Ratings American Potato Salad 324 Ratings Benno's Bacon Potato Salad 5 Ratings Mom's Italian Potato Salad 14 Ratings Classic American-Style Potato Salad 107 Ratings My Mom's Good Old Potato Salad 124 Ratings All Canadian Potato Salad 8 Ratings Tangy Potato Salad 14 Ratings Lela's Fourth of July Potato Salad 12 Ratings Roasted Potato Salad 103 Ratings Potato and Bacon Salad 293 Ratings Southern Potato Salad 720 Ratings Asian Potato Salad 59 Ratings Roasted Potato and Garlic Salad 36 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: MRANDAL
instructions: Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain. Return potatoes to the empty pot to dry and cool.;Stir mayonnaise, pickles, hard-cooked eggs, red onion, celery, mustard, and cider vinegar together in a large bowl; season to taste with salt and pepper. Fold in cooled potatoes until well combined.;For best results, store potato salad in the refrigerator until chilled or overnight before serving to allow the flavors to meld. naples34102
